tasks.audioText: The researcher presented preliminary findings at the conference. The data tends to suggest that prolonged screen time may adversely affect children's cognitive development.
tasks.transcript: The data tends to suggest that prolonged screen time may adversely affect children's cognitive development.

options.text: The data conclusively proves that screens harm children.
The evidence leans towards indicating that extended screen exposure could negatively impact young minds.
Screen time has absolutely no effect on children.
The researcher recommends more screen time for children.

tasks.explanation: 'Tends to suggest' and 'may adversely affect' are hedging devices. The researcher avoids definitive claims, presenting a cautious interpretation of the data.

tasks.audioText: The manager discussed the quarterly performance with the team. It seems that our marketing strategy hasn't quite delivered the results we were hoping for.
tasks.transcript: It seems that our marketing strategy hasn't quite delivered the results we were hoping for.

options.text: The marketing strategy was a complete disaster.
The marketing strategy exceeded all expectations.
The marketing approach appears to have fallen somewhat short of their desired outcomes.
They never had a marketing strategy.

tasks.explanation: 'It seems' and 'hasn't quite delivered' soften the criticism. Rather than directly saying the strategy failed, the speaker uses vague language to cushion the assessment.

tasks.audioText: The doctor discussed the test results with the patient. There appears to be some sort of irregularity in your blood work, but it could be nothing serious.
tasks.transcript: There appears to be some sort of irregularity in your blood work, but it could be nothing serious.

options.text: The blood tests revealed a life-threatening condition.
Something slightly unusual showed up in the blood tests, though it might not be a cause for concern.
The blood work was perfectly normal.
The doctor refused to discuss the results.

tasks.explanation: 'Appears to be', 'some sort of', and 'could be nothing serious' are hedging expressions. The doctor cautiously acknowledges an abnormality while avoiding alarm.

tasks.audioText: The economist was interviewed about the housing market. Prices are sort of plateauing, I suppose, though predicting the next quarter is rather tricky.
tasks.transcript: Prices are sort of plateauing, I suppose, though predicting the next quarter is rather tricky.

options.text: Housing prices are definitely going to crash next quarter.
Prices seem to be levelling off, although forecasting the near future is quite difficult.
The economist is certain prices will rise sharply.
The housing market has completely collapsed.

tasks.explanation: 'Sort of', 'I suppose', and 'rather tricky' are hedging and vague expressions. The economist avoids committing to a firm prediction.

tasks.audioText: The diplomat briefed journalists after the meeting. Apparently, both sides have expressed a willingness to resume talks, though nothing concrete has been agreed upon yet.
tasks.transcript: Apparently, both sides have expressed a willingness to resume talks, though nothing concrete has been agreed upon yet.

options.text: A comprehensive peace deal has been signed.
Both parties have reportedly shown interest in continuing negotiations, but no firm commitments have been made.
Both sides refuse to negotiate under any conditions.
The meeting was cancelled at the last moment.

tasks.explanation: 'Apparently' signals reported information, and 'nothing concrete' hedges against overstatement. The diplomat conveys cautious optimism without certainty.

tasks.audioText: The professor reviewed the student's thesis draft. Your argument is somewhat compelling, but it might benefit from a more nuanced analysis of the counterarguments.
tasks.transcript: Your argument is somewhat compelling, but it might benefit from a more nuanced analysis of the counterarguments.

options.text: The thesis is perfect and needs no revision.
The thesis is terrible and should be completely rewritten.
The argument has some merit, but could be improved by addressing opposing viewpoints more thoroughly.
The professor refused to read the thesis.

tasks.explanation: 'Somewhat compelling' and 'might benefit from' are hedging phrases that soften the feedback. The professor offers constructive criticism diplomatically.

tasks.audioText: The lawyer addressed the court cautiously. It would appear that the evidence, such as it is, does not conclusively establish the defendant's involvement.
tasks.transcript: It would appear that the evidence, such as it is, does not conclusively establish the defendant's involvement.

options.text: The evidence clearly proves the defendant is guilty.
The available evidence, limited as it may be, does not definitively prove the accused person's participation.
There is no evidence in this case at all.
The lawyer confirmed the defendant's guilt.

tasks.explanation: 'It would appear', 'such as it is', and 'not conclusively' are layered hedging devices. The lawyer carefully questions the strength of the evidence.

tasks.audioText: The project manager updated the stakeholders. We're more or less on schedule, though there have been a couple of minor setbacks with the supply chain.
tasks.transcript: We're more or less on schedule, though there have been a couple of minor setbacks with the supply chain.

options.text: The project is significantly behind schedule.
The project is roughly on track despite a few small supply issues.
The project was completed ahead of schedule.
The supply chain is functioning perfectly.

tasks.explanation: 'More or less', 'a couple of', and 'minor setbacks' are vague and minimizing expressions. The manager softens the impact of delays.

tasks.audioText: The climate scientist was asked about rising sea levels. There is a reasonable likelihood that coastal flooding will become increasingly frequent over the coming decades.
tasks.transcript: There is a reasonable likelihood that coastal flooding will become increasingly frequent over the coming decades.

options.text: Coastal flooding will definitely stop within the next decade.
It is fairly probable that floods in coastal areas will occur more often in the next several decades.
Sea levels have no connection to coastal flooding.
The scientist guarantees no flooding will occur.

tasks.explanation: 'A reasonable likelihood' and 'increasingly frequent' are measured hedging terms typical of academic discourse. The scientist avoids absolute predictions.

tasks.audioText: The art critic reviewed the controversial installation. The piece is kind of thought-provoking, in a way, though its artistic merit is open to interpretation.
tasks.transcript: The piece is kind of thought-provoking, in a way, though its artistic merit is open to interpretation.

options.text: The critic declared the installation a masterpiece.
The work is somewhat stimulating intellectually, but whether it qualifies as good art is debatable.
The critic found the piece completely uninteresting.
Everyone agrees the installation has no artistic value.

tasks.explanation: 'Kind of', 'in a way', and 'open to interpretation' are vague language markers. The critic avoids a definitive aesthetic judgement.

tasks.audioText: The HR director spoke to the department heads. I would tentatively suggest that we might want to consider restructuring the onboarding process at some point.
tasks.transcript: I would tentatively suggest that we might want to consider restructuring the onboarding process at some point.

options.text: She demanded an immediate overhaul of the onboarding process.
She very cautiously raised the idea that it could be worth rethinking how new employees are introduced.
The onboarding process has already been restructured.
She said the current onboarding process is perfect.

tasks.explanation: 'Would tentatively suggest', 'might want to consider', and 'at some point' create multiple layers of hedging. The speaker is extremely cautious about proposing change.

tasks.audioText: The financial analyst briefed the investors. The market seems to be showing signs of recovery, although it is perhaps too early to draw any definitive conclusions.
tasks.transcript: The market seems to be showing signs of recovery, although it is perhaps too early to draw any definitive conclusions.

options.text: The market recovery is guaranteed and complete.
The market appears to be recovering, but it may be premature to make firm judgements.
The market is in total collapse with no hope of recovery.
The analyst refused to comment on the market.

tasks.explanation: 'Seems to be showing signs' and 'perhaps too early' use hedging to express cautious optimism. The analyst acknowledges positive indicators without committing.

tasks.audioText: The sociologist discussed social media's influence on youth. One might argue that online platforms have, to some extent, reshaped the way young people form their identities.
tasks.transcript: One might argue that online platforms have, to some extent, reshaped the way young people form their identities.

options.text: Social media has completely destroyed young people's sense of identity.
Social media has no influence on identity formation.
It could be said that digital platforms have partially changed how the youth construct their sense of self.
The sociologist avoided discussing social media entirely.

tasks.explanation: 'One might argue' and 'to some extent' are classic academic hedging. The sociologist suggests a partial influence without overstating the claim.

tasks.audioText: The engineer presented the safety report to the board. The structural integrity of the bridge is, as far as we can tell, adequate, but ongoing monitoring would be advisable.
tasks.transcript: The structural integrity of the bridge is, as far as we can tell, adequate, but ongoing monitoring would be advisable.

options.text: The bridge is perfectly safe and needs no further monitoring.
The bridge should be demolished immediately.
Based on current knowledge, the bridge appears sufficiently sound, though continued observation is recommended.
The engineer has not inspected the bridge.

tasks.explanation: 'As far as we can tell' and 'would be advisable' hedge the assessment. The engineer signals confidence limits while recommending precautionary measures.

tasks.audioText: The psychologist discussed the study's limitations. The findings are broadly consistent with the hypothesis, although certain variables may not have been adequately controlled for.
tasks.transcript: The findings are broadly consistent with the hypothesis, although certain variables may not have been adequately controlled for.

options.text: The study perfectly confirmed the hypothesis with no limitations.
The results generally support the theory, but some factors might not have been sufficiently accounted for.
The findings completely contradict the hypothesis.
The psychologist found no variables worth discussing.

tasks.explanation: 'Broadly consistent', 'certain variables', and 'may not have been adequately controlled' hedge the conclusions. The researcher acknowledges limitations while affirming general support.
